experience: You and Peter both know Aaron D. Bare, Clarence McAllister,P.E.,RCDD, and 18 others

Currently serving as a key member in the development of Ruaha Energy.  A renewable energy company specializing in bringing hydroelectric, solar, biomass, wind and other forms of clean renewable energy to the communities of Sub-Saharan Africa. He has completed design for 2 small hydroelectric power plants in the village of Musanze, Rwanda as well as overseeing the feasibility study for 5 small hydro power plants in the Lukosi Basin of Tanzania.  He has collaborated with numerous federal agencies currently operating under the U.S. Governments Power Africa initiative.

Currently serving as President of the Executive Board of Phoenix American Youth Football.  Brings over 30 years of youth football experience to this position having served in capacities including coaching, association board member as well as an association President.  Was selected to the National American Youth Football Hall of Fame in 2012.

Pete is an Executive Vice President at Ritoch-Powell and has 30 years of professional experience in design engineering. He is responsible for Public and Private clients.  He has completed large and diverse projects bringing added value to a diverse clientele by providing them with a strong team that is committed to providing the best service possible
Pete served as a Principal at Wood/Patel  for 8 years in charge of the Public Works Division and served as a Project Manager on select projects.

Served as Principal for municipal projects in the office the office as well as project manager on select projects.   Oversaw operations for the subsurface utility engineering (SUE) group of the firm starting from it's inception into generating revenue of $2M plus within 18 months.  Established new operations in Nevada and Southern California.

summary: As a key member of Ritoch-Powell's team, Pete is committed to  developing long-term relationships with clients and has developed an understanding that reaches beyond merely providing engineering services. He provides a higher level of service by developing forward-looking solutions to the engineering opportunities facing municipalities today and the future issues associated with the continued population growth in Arizona.
